hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime BTC Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 10-day realized volatility below 40% and 20-day Bollinger Band width compresses to <15% of the 20-day SMA, a breakout above the upper Bollinger Band on >1.5x average volume will initiate a short-term bullish momentum phase targeting a 5% move within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes often exhibit volatility compression before directional moves. Low volatility in neutral environments suggests indecision that typically resolves with momentum. Volume confirmation reduces false breakouts.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Bollinger Band width <15% of 20-day SMA
BTC closes above upper Bollinger Band
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain above Bollinger Band within 24 hours or price returns below SMA before hitting TP, occurring in >40% of historical instances in neutral regimes.
